definition: lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
lit. to treat (what sb says) as wind past your ear/fig. to completely disregard

sentences.english: But their quality call mainly fell on deaf ears in the U.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們在質量方面的呼籲在美國卻被當作耳旁風。
湯姆沒把法官的警告當耳旁風。
湯姆沒把法官的警告當耳旁風。

sentences.english: You regard the beneficial words as a puff of wind, and will regret it sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 你把金玉良言當作耳旁風，總有一天會後悔的。

sentences.english: What I say goes in one ear and out the other.
sentences.chinese: 我所說的全被當做耳旁風了。

sentences.english: She would feel heartbroken if she knew that her advice to you had fallen on deaf ears.
sentences.chinese: 如果她知道你把她的忠告當成耳旁風，她會很傷心的。
